story.storykicker: It's not only the Congress that is under threat, but seventh Samajwadi Party candidate also faces uncertainty.
story.storybody:
The Rajya Sabha elections are generally a closed-door affair and given the nature of such contests, most candidates know they would win.

However, in the crucial state of Uttar Pradesh, the entry of an independent candidate Preeti Mahapatra with the BJP's backing has made it an interesting contest as the 37-year-old could upset the prospect of veteran Congress leader and former Union minister Kapil Sibal, who is seeking election to the Upper House from the state.

It's not only the Congress that is under threat, but the Samajwadi Party candidate also faces uncertainty. Backed by the BJP, Preeti needs 29 non-BJP votes to win. Cross-voting or support from smaller parties and the independents could see her sail through, but it may kill the chances of either Sibal or the seventh candidate from the ruling SP.

Apart from Mahapatra, there are 11 other Rajya Sabha candidates from UP - SP's seven, BSP's two, and Congress's one.

One needs to have at least 34 votes to win and the Congress has only 29 MLAs in the UP Assembly. Sibal needs five non-Congress votes, which looks difficult since Preeti, according to several media reports, is riding high on money power and BJP support.

(It is no secret that money buys votes in such elections. The Aam Aadmi Party has already complained to the Election Commission about a Rajya Sabha candidate from Karnataka)

The current UP Assembly can only elect 11 Rajya Sabha nominees, but Preeti would force voting since she is the 12th nominee.

Extra votes that may go to Preeti or Sibal:

BSP: 12

RLD: 8 

Independents: 6 

Peace Party: 4 

Qaumi Ekta Dal: 2  

In the 403-member UP Assembly, the ruling Samajwadi party has 229 MLAs, BSP 80, BJP 41 and Congress 29.
story.magazinekicker: It's not only the Congress that is under threat, but seventh Samajwadi Party candidate also faces uncertainty.
story.shortheadline: Can Preeti Mahapatra win Rajya Sabha election from UP and nix Kapil Sibal's chances?
story.storytitle: Can Preeti Mahapatra win election from Uttar Pradesh and nix Kapil Sibal's chances?
